body.p: BRUHN SCHOOL ! Mr, and Mrs. Wnjriehowaki and: Mrs. Peter Buss made a business trip to Stevens Point last week. A large number of friends and relatives gathered at the Frank Bamke home Thursday to help Mrs. Bamke celebrate her birthday. The evening WM spent at playing cards. PrUes were' awarded to Leo Wojclohowafci, John Keel and Mrs. Cheater Kledrowski Mr. and Mrs. Albin Oatrowaki and family spent Sunday at the William Kuehn and John Buss homes in Norsrie. Mrs. Mary Bruhn and son Jerry of Milwaukee arrived Thursday evening to spend the weekend with Mr. and Mrs. Leo Wojeiehowski and family. Mrs. Peter Buss returned to Milwaukee with them Monday night. Mr. and Mrs. Frank Bamke and daughter Dorothy shopped at Wausau Thursday. Mr. and Mrs. Paul Seefeldt and family spent Sunday with Mrs. Louis Hegewald and family. Mr. and Mrs. Leo Wojeiehowski, Mrs. Peter Buss and Mrs. Mary Bruhn made a business trip to Pulaski saturday. Mr. and Mr. Tony Bamke and children shopped at Wausau Wednesday. Mr. and Mrs. Spencer Johnson and son Robert and Mrs. Louis Johnson of Elderon visited with Mr. and Mrs. Jonas Halverson and family Sunday. A child was born to Mr. and Mrs. Norman Olsen Tuesday. Mr, and Mrs. Tom Halverson and children attended the funeral of Mr, Halversonâ€™s father at Rosholt Mon- day. Mr. and Mrs. Floyd Morey and children. Miss Florence Grunewald and Russell Buck spent Sunday at Crandon, John Spranger and daughter Marita of Rudolph were guests at the Gerhard Spranger and Andrew Graeyalny homes Sunday. Many friends assisted Mr. Keel in the celebration of his birthday at his home Tuesday evening. Prizes at cards were awarded to Math. Spranger, Andrew Gracyainy, Mrs. Herman Gusman and Mrs. John Lukasko. The Clifford McVay family have muted their household foods to Mustek where they will reside. We are Happy to report that the fourteen children who were on the sick list last week, have all returned to school,
